adjectives.description: obligated (comparative more obligated, superlative most obligated)

entries.meaning: (Canada, US, Scotland) having an obligation; obliged
examples: Under a provision of a larger piece of legislation, popularly known as the Customs Bill, that has been approved by the House and is expected to soon pass the Senate, American officials will be obligated to treat the settlements as part of Israel in future trade negotiations.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of obligate
